sub_title: Making business more sustainable and smarter
summary:
I believe that any kind of sustainable development requires converting inspiring ideas into realisable plans, as well as effective implementation. I work in the area of logistics, transport policy and infrastructure development and see these as crucial enablers for businesses, countries and cities to prosper. 

Currently I am translating that belief in building a sustainable and reciprocal floriculture brand. We aim to provide a better, more predictable quality to consumers. at the same time we strive for continous improvement in the supply chain by harnessing the power of sharing. I am responsible for the formulation and implementation  of our strategic projects.

Previously, I manage a team of experienced (junior) consultants and students conducting a thorough analysis of the processes in the floriculture supply chain. We work with entrepreneurs and managers from the industry as well as researchers to achieve this.

Prior to this, I have worked with a University/Research Institute and a Consultancy. Clients included businesses, the Dutch government, several European Institutions and national/State-level governments in emerging countries to strengthen the quality of transport policies and projects. This gives me a deep and thorough understanding of both the commercial, political and social aspects of business and policy.

Both during my studies and my job as Consultant I have lived and worked in Canada and India respectively. These stays have shown me that I am able to achieve results, even under challenges circumstances.

education.degree_name: Master of Science in Economics & Business

awards.title: Diamond Project
awards.description: DAVINC3I was quoted as one of two diamond projects from a portfolio of 15+ projects. Dinalog (financer of the project) appreciated the projects as exceptionally strong in leveraging the power of scientific research and education for the application in Small and Medium Enterprises. Dinalog also valued the engagement of SMEs in the project.

projects.title: Evaluation of the Regulatory Framework for Mandatory Occurrence Reporting in Civil Aviation
projects.description: The Dutch Government actively pursues safe aviation. One of the means to achieve safety is the Mandatory Occurrence System for civil aviation - in line with European guidelines. 2 Year after its implementation a Committee and Ecorys evaluated the regulatory framework as to establish the potential for further improvement. The full report is available for download.

projects.title: DAVINC3I
projects.description: How can the Netherlands maintain its world leadership in the floricultural industry? Which means are available to realise remote trade, logistics and coordination? Within the DaVinc3i project, growers, traders, logistics service providers and 3 Dutch universities are developing ideas about this.

projects.title: FlowerPack Pro
projects.description:
Flower logistics from Africa make up a large share of the costs of getting products to the markets in Europe and elsewhere. Additionally, the transport and handling brings about major quality risks.
FlowerPack Pro, initially carrying a variety of other names, was conceived to reduce costs and increase quality. in cooperation with Schiphol Group, KLM Royal Dutch Airlines and various other supply chain partners, we developed and tested the concept of a better box for carrying flowers from.Africa to their international destinations.

projects.title: iFlow
projects.description:
The strength of the Dutch floriculture cluster depends in part on the (commercial and physical) availability of goods and availability of market information. The iFLOW is a floriculture value chain project aimed at strengthening the Dutch cluster in the global marketplace.
Robert has been hired by FloraHolland, ultimately responsible for the project, to kickstart and manage this project.

projects.title: Integrated Transport Policy for a State in North India
projects.description: As a first in India, this State in the North West has taken on the development of an integrated transport policy. The policy derives the required infrastructure, transport services and policies for both passengers and freight - based on socio-economic scenarios for the development of the State. My role was project manager and, as such, I was involved in all aspects of the content: technical and managerial.

courses.name: Economics of the Logistics and Transportation Firm

profile_positions.description: Logistics is all about doing things smarter. As such I have joined TKI Dinalog to support the wider logistics industry in its efforts to be innovative. By connecting practice and research, specifically in the field of city and agro logistics, I contribute to this higher objective.
profile_positions.title: Program Manager City Logistics, Circular Economy and Agri & Food Logistics

profile_positions.description: Bloemenmagazijn Johan (a name that is about to be succeeded by a more exciting brand) wants to be a smart and strategic organisation. As such I have taken on the role of innovator. In this capacity I develop new and smarter ways of running a flower service provider.
profile_positions.title: Innovator

profile_positions.description:
The floriculture supply chain has been a one-way street for too long. Bloemenmagazijn Johan has asked me to lead a journey towards a better customer experience for consumers and suppliers. We provide feedback to our suppliers to ensure an ever better quality of product. We provide this feedback because we believe consumers deserve more: a reliable product; buying plants or flowers should not be a lottery.

In just a year we have implemented a custom inventory management system, route planning, and customer service management systems. We have also modernised the financial management of the organisation and brought it upto speed in terms of Human Resource Management.
profile_positions.title: Managing Director

profile_positions.description: The floriculture supply chain has been a one-way street for too long. Roots aims to become a brand of plants and flowers that is different: we provide feedback to our suppliers to ensure an ever better quality of product. We provide this feedback because we believe consumers deserve more: a reliable product; buying plants or flowers should not be a lottery.
profile_positions.title: Strategic Advisor

profile_positions.description:
Royal FloraHolland pursues a new strategy aimed at readying the Cooperative for the future. We want to realise better margins for our members and their clients as a result. Given the importance of logistics for floriculture products and our own logistics operations, logistics is one of the central pillars of the new strategy.  I work as a Project Manager and Supply Chain Developer in the Logistics Strategy & Implementation Team.

First, I was responsible for a team of 6 colleagues to deliver a in-depth description of the floriculture supply chain. Subsequently, I co-developed the strategic directions for the company.  Then I initiated the development of a new logistics means for international floriculture supply chains. I also delivered  recommendations to the Government of Ethiopia on allowing consolidation of flowers; these recommendations have largely been accepted.
profile_positions.title: (Project) Manager Logistics Strategy & Implementation

profile_positions.description:
As part of the new strategy, Royal FloraHolland implemented a separate governance structure for the implementation of our strategy. Transformation Leads are responsible for the implementation of the required changes in their respective functional area.

As Transformation Lead I analyse projects, assess their contribution to the RFH strategy and (help to) resolve issues. I coordinate these across functional areas and report to the COO.

(Initially, I was Transformation Co-lead, later ad interim Transformation Lead).
profile_positions.title: Transformation Lead Supply Chain

profile_positions.description:
The success of applied research depends on the involvement and commitment of companies to that research. It is my role at LEI Wageningen UR to ensure the involvement and commitment in the field of IT and logistics innovation projects.

Achievements:
* Acquisition of a new project on floriculture logistics: DAVINC3I Community
* Acquisition of a €30 mn European Commission project on Internet of Things in the agricultural industry: Internet of Farm and Food 2020 (IoF2020)
* Awarded Best Team Award for the IoF2020 project
* Delivery of a Roadmap for the development of high-tech applications for the fruitsector
profile_positions.title: Business Manager IT Innovation

profile_positions.description: The successful business models of the future increasingly require cooperation and innovation between value (supply) chain partners. That's where we provide support: by providing an independent and neutral link between knowledge, innovation and cooperation. Whether this is in the Netherlands or India: we are able to help you.
profile_positions.title: Development & Project Management

profile_positions.description:
DAVINC3I (Dutch Agricultural Virtualized International Network with Consolidation, Coordination, Collaboration and Information availability) is about maintaining Dutch leadership in the world floricultural industry: this concerns primarily the trade and logistics aspects in a increasingly virtual world. The means to achieving this goal is by researching innovative, responsive logistics concepts supported by new IT applications. As an industry with a long history in cooperation between independent companies, we expect those concepts and applications to still be based on cooperation. Therefore, we are also developing business rules for cooperation specific to those concepts.

As project manager I am responsible for the development of the business aspects of the projects. For example by linking practice (leading entrepreneurs from the industry) and theory (PhDs and post-docs, as well as students). In part thanks to my involvement, the number of students part of the project has increased from around 10 a year to around 30 per year. Moreover, around 30 companies have been or are involved. A number of the projects have resulted in recommendations actually implemented by host companies.

This was a 3 year contract position. I am officially employed by Wageningen University, but am reporting to managers at Wageningen University, FloraHolland and VGB.

Achievements:
- Doubled consortium size to around 35 SMEs (not an explicit target)
- Managed around 55 sub projects (from initiation to closure)
- Involved and coached around 55 students (target: 20)
- No project budget overruns
- Initiated and supported around 5 spin-offs
- Developed a well-appreciated series of Masterclasses with a small operational profit
profile_positions.title: Business Project Manager DAVINC3I

profile_positions.description: As local representative I worked to establish and to develop a new office for Ecorys in India. This mainly involves building a network of clients and associate experts, representing the company at selected occasions, acquiring assignments and dealing with administrative matters associated with establishing the subsidiary. Moreover, I recruited the current Managing Director for Ecorys India.
profile_positions.title: Manager Business Development (India)

profile_positions.description:
Conducting (economic) analyses of projects and initiatives related to transport, mobility and infrastructure, providing policy advise to governments at multiple levels. Strong focus on project management issues with these projects. Developed significant skills in intercultural communication and management.

Selection of over 20 projects participated in (as consultant, project manager or both):
- Ex-ante Evaluation of the Dutch Mandatory Occurrence Reporting System for Civil Aviation
- Cost-Benefit Analysis of a New Airport in Tanzania
- Review of South Asian Highway Agencies and development of a performance indicator framework
- Development of an integrated transport policy and strategic investment plan for the State of Punjab (India)
- Impact Assessment of the EU Action Plan on Urban Mobility
- Feasibility Study for Amsterdam metro (North South Line)
- Project management (only) of EU Benchmarking study on logistics
- Cost-Benefit Analysis of MarNIS (Maritime Navigation and Information Services, EU Framework Programme project)

Most of my projects involved external partners and the majority of projects were budgetted between € 200,000 and € 2,000,000.
profile_positions.title: Consultant Transport & Mobility

profile_positions.description: Conducting (economic) analyses of projects and initiatives related to transport, mobility and infrastructure, providing policy advise to governments at multiple levels and in various countries. In general the role was more supportive, although Robert also managed a major European research project by himself right from the start of his carreer with Ecorys.
profile_positions.title: Junior Consultant Transport & Mobility

profile_positions.description: Assist the HR department across the scope of its activities and improve the efficiency of these processes at the secretariat of the department.
profile_positions.title: HR employee

profile_positions.description: Graduation research on cooperation between KLM Royal Dutch Airlines, Schiphol Group, and Air Traffic Control the Netherlands
profile_positions.title: Graduation Intern

volunteer_experiences.description:
As President of the Board I was ultimately responsible for the running of the Study Association as a whole. The board is responsible for the daily management of the association of Transito and organises interesting activities for its members regularly, such as lectures, in-house days, excursions, company visits, and of course social drinks. 

Transito is the study association for the Bachelor and Master program Urban, Port & Transport Economics of the Erasmus University Rotterdam. The association is completely organised by students and has the aim to offer a glance at the world behind the studies.
